DataElement.preferredName: Mutant Allele Burden Laboratory Procedure Abnormality Detection Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The outcomes associated with the abnormalities detected on the JMML Mutant Allele Burden test.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Mutant Allele Burden Laboratory Procedure Abnormality Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An altered form of an individual, organism, population, or genetic character that differs from the corresponding wild type due to one or more alterations (mutations)._one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product._The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An altered form of an individual, organism, population, or genetic character that differs from the corresponding wild type due to one or more alterations (mutations).:one of a series of possible alternative forms of a given gene, differing in DNA sequence, and affecting the functioning of a single product.:The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: An altered form of an individual, organism, population, or genetic character that differs from the corresponding wild type due to one or more alterations (mutations).

Mutually exclusive alternative forms of the same gene occupying the same locus on homologous chromosomes, differing in nucleotide sequence and governing the same biochemical and developmental process.
The quantity of something that is borne or carried by an individual or population.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.:The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

Concepts.definition: A condition that differs from the usual physical or mental state.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

PermissibleValues.value: Additional acquirement of JMML somatic gene abnormalities
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Acquisition Juvenile Myelomonocytic Leukemia Somatic Cell Genetics Abnormal Additional

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Acquisition Juvenile Myelomonocytic Leukemia Somatic Cell Genetics Abnormal Additional
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm of childhood that is characterized by proliferation principally of the granulocytic and monocytic lineages.  Myelomonocytic proliferation is seen in the bone marrow and the blood.  The leukemic cells may infiltrate any tissue, however liver, spleen, lymph nodes, skin, and respiratory tract are the most common sites of involvement. (WHO, 2001): Various methods for gene function studies that rely on the use of cells in culture.: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.: Added; extra; further.

Concepts.definition: The process by which something is acquired or obtained.

A clonal myeloid disorder of childhood previously classified as myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm. It is characterized by the presence of monocytic proliferation in peripheral blood, less than 20% blasts in bone marrow and peripheral blood, splenomegaly, and the absence of BCR-ABL1 fusion. Almost all patients carry mutations of the RAS pathway.
Various methods for gene function studies that rely on the use of cells in culture.
Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.
Added; extra; further.
